text: CNA Center is a 622-ft (189m), 44-story high-rise building at 333 South Wabash Avenue in the Loop of Chicago, Illinois.CNA Plaza on Emporis.com The building is well known for lighting logos or messages on the front side of the building or for its dark red color. It is the tallest red building in Chicago. Construction began in March 1970. The building was finished in 1972 and was open to the public in 1973. ==References== ==Other websites== *CNA Center Lighted Window Message Archive *Informative site Category:1972 establishments in Illinois
title: CNA Center
